Class FileRetrieveServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • FileRetrieveServer

  • public class FileRetrieveServer
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsible for starting and controlling all server functionality
    Author:
    Kyle Dorcey

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.net.Socket connection
      Defines the socket Object which is used to pass and receive the client and servers IP and port numbers
      private java.io.ObjectInputStream input
      Stream used to recieve data from the client
      private java.io.ObjectOutputStream output
      Stream used to send data to the client
      private java.net.ServerSocket server
      Defines the servers ServerSocket which will be used to link the server to the client

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileRetrieveServer()
      No argument class constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String checkForFile(java.lang.String fileName)
      Called by the processConnection() method, checks if the client requested file exists and returns a string containing its contents if it finds one.
      void closeConnection()
      Closes the connection between the server and client by first closing the ObjectOutputStream, inputOutputStream, and Socket
      void getClientsStream()
      When called (and connection has been previously defined), this method sets the ObjectOutputStream to send data to the client
      void processConnection()
      This method contains the servers logic.
      void sendData(java.lang.String message)
      Used to send data to the client
      void startServer()
      Method responsible for creating the server.
      void waitForClient()
      Waits for a cliet to connect to the server's socket.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • server

        private java.net.ServerSocket server
        Defines the servers ServerSocket which will be used to link the server to the client

      • connection

        private java.net.Socket connection
        Defines the socket Object which is used to pass and receive the client and servers IP and port numbers

      • output

        private java.io.ObjectOutputStream output
        Stream used to send data to the client

        private java.io.ObjectInputStream input
        Stream used to recieve data from the client

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileRetrieveServer

        public FileRetrieveServer()
        No argument class constructor

    • Method Detail

      • startServer

        public void startServer()
        Method responsible for creating the server. As this is the class for the server the while-loop will run until the program is closed. Assuming neither waitForClient(), getClientStream(), or processConnection() throw an IOException the server will process information from a single client.

      • waitForClient

        public void waitForClient()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Waits for a cliet to connect to the server's socket. When the server accepts a connection it defines the connection variable.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws in the event the server's socket cannot connect to the client's socket properly

      • getClientsStream

        public void getClientsStream()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        When called (and connection has been previously defined), this method sets the ObjectOutputStream to send data to the client
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws in the event that the client and servers streams do not connect properly

      • processConnection

        public void processConnection()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        This method contains the servers logic. In this case, the server will recieve a file-path from the client. It will then check that the file exists. If it does, it will send the file's contents to the client.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws in the event that the method cannot properly deserialize the client's output (or server's input)

      • checkForFile

        public java.lang.String checkForFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Called by the processConnection() method, checks if the client requested file exists and returns a string containing its contents if it finds one.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Path to the file to read from
        Returns:
        String foundFileInfo, contains the contents of the file that the client requested.

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        Closes the connection between the server and client by first closing the ObjectOutputStream, inputOutputStream, and Socket

      • sendData

        public void sendData(java.lang.String message)
        Used to send data to the client
        Parameters:
        message - String to send to client
